***Work in progress***. This course will cover the basics of calculus, and will include practical examples using R and Python programming languages.

## Introduction to this course
This course provides a detailed foundation in calculus, covering topics such as limits, derivatives, integrals, differential equations, and applications of calculus. The course will also include practical examples and exercises using R and Python programming languages.

![Machine Learning Pillars](images/machine_learning_pillars_calculus.png){width=600}

## What is 

### Definition
Calculus is a branch of mathematics that deals with the study of rates of change and accumulation. It includes two main branches: differential calculus, which focuses on the concept of the derivative, and integral calculus, which focuses on the concept of the integral.

### Significance
Calculus is an essential tool in various fields, including science, engineering, economics, finance, and social sciences. It helps in modeling and analyzing complex systems, optimizing processes, and solving real-world problems.

### Applications in various fields
Calculus is used in various fields, such as:
- Science: to model physical systems and analyze experimental data.
- Engineering: to design and optimize systems and processes.
- Economics: to model economic behavior and optimize decision-making.
- Finance: to model financial markets and optimize investment strategies.
- Social sciences: to model social phenomena and analyze data.
- Healthcare: to model biological systems and optimize treatment strategies.
- Machine learning: to build predictive models and analyze data.
- Quality control: to monitor and improve processes.
- Computer graphics: to model shapes and animations.
